column4: COLUMN-Why I'm ditching my Amazon account
column5: (The opinions expressed here are those of the author  a columnist for Reuters.)

column4: Nitto Denko to ease reliance on display business
column5: OSAKA  Japan  May 27 Japan's Nitto Denko Corp   an Apple Inc supplier that makes industrial films and tapes  expects its reliance on volatile business in display screens to ease as it courts customers in autos and other industries  its chief executive said.

column4: Foxconn to buy $390 million stake in Taiwan telecom operator in 4G push
column5: TAIPEI Apple Inc supplier Foxconn Technology Group will buy a stake in Taiwanese mobile telecoms operator Asia Pacific Telecom for T$11.6 billion ($390 million) in a deal that would expand its presence in Taiwan's fledgling 4G telecoms market.

column4: Taiwan stocks rise; Asia Pacific gains on stake sale to Hon Hai
column5: TAIPEI  May 27 Taiwan stocks rose 0.18 percent in early trade on Tuesday  led by local wireless operator Asia Pacific Telecom Co Ltd  which announced it would sell a stake and eventually merge with a unit of Apple Inc  supplier Hon Hai Precision Industry Co Ltd.     As of 0225 GMT  the main TAIEX index was up 16.35 points at 9 052.47  largely in line with other regional and global bourses and extending the previous session's 0.31 percent gain.     Asia Pacific Telecom rose 2.8 percen

column4: BioCryst hereditary disorder drug succeeds in trial  shares jump
column5: BioCryst Pharmaceuticals Inc's oral drug to prevent a hereditary disorder characterized by abnormal swelling was effective in reducing attacks  sending the drugmaker's shares up as much as 22 percent.

column4: UPDATE 2-BioCryst hereditary disorder drug succeeds in trial  shares jump
column5: * Drug  if approved  will be first oral preventive for hereditary angioedema

column4: BioCryst's immune disorder drug succeeds in mid-stage trial
column5: May 27 BioCryst Pharmaceuticals Inc  said its experimental drug for treating a rare immune disorder was effective in reducing the attacks of the disease in a mid-stage trial.

column4: U.S. should reject Comcast-TWC merger - NY Times editorial
column5: WASHINGTON  May 27 U.S. regulators should challenge the proposed $45 billion merger of the two largest American cable providers  Comcast Corp and Time Warner Cable Inc  the New York Times said in an editorial in Tuesday's newspaper.

column4: LightSquared  creditors head to judge-supervised mediation
column5: NEW YORK  May 27 LightSquared and its creditors  including Dish Network Corp Chairman Charles Ergen  will go into court-ordered mediation to settle on a plan to restructure the bankrupt wireless venture  lawyers said on Tuesday.

column4: RPT-Iranian judge summons Facebook CEO for breach of privacy
column5: DUBAI  May 27 A conservative Iranian court opened a case against instant messaging services WhatsApp and Instagram while also summoning Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg over complaints of privacy violation  state news agency ISNA reported on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Intel to make tablet chips with China's Rockchip
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  May 27 Intel Corp said on Tuesday it reached an agreement with Chinese mobile chipmaker Rockchip to make chips for inexpensive tablets running Google Inc's Android platform.

column4: Intel to make mobile chip with China's Rockchip
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  May 27 Intel Corp said on Tuesday it reached an agreement with Chinese mobile chipmaker Rockchip to make chips for inexpensive tablets running Google Inc's Android platform.

column4: Intuit to buy Check Inc for $360 million
column5: JERUSALEM  Intuit Inc INTU.O  developer of tax-preparation software TurboTax  said it had entered into a definitive agreement to buy bill-payment service Check Inc for $360 million in cash and other considerations.

column4: RPT-UPDATE 2-Intuit to buy Check Inc for $360 mln
column5: (Updates with Intuit confirmation; adds comments/background)

column5: May 27 Intuit Inc  developer of tax-preparation software TurboTax  agreed to buy Check Inc  a bill-payment service  for $360 million in a deal that was signed on Friday  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the situation.

column4: Exclusive: Mercury Systems pulls sale - sources
column5: Mercury Systems Inc  a supplier of digital signal and image processing systems to the aerospace and defense industry  has ended its exploration of a near-term sale  said three people familiar with the matter.

column4: MoneyGram claims bank status in tax dispute with U.S. IRS
column5: WASHINGTON  May 27 MoneyGram International Inc  is fighting in U.S. Tax Court to prove it is a bank  a designation the Internal Revenue Service disputed when it blocked $900 million in tax deductions by the world's second-largest money transfer company.

column4: Beastie Boys fight for rights to songs in trial vs. Monster
column5: NEW YORK The Beastie Boys hip-hop group turned to the courts on Tuesday to fight for their right to not let energy drink maker Monster Beverage Corp use their songs.

column4: Beastie Boys fight for rights to songs in trial vs. Monster
column5: NEW YORK  May 27 The Beastie Boys hip-hop group turned to the courts on Tuesday to fight for their right to not let energy drink maker Monster Beverage Corp use their songs.

column4: Pilgrim's bid for Hillshire puts Pinnacle deal in peril
column5: Pilgrim's Pride Corp  on Tuesday offered to buy Hillshire Brands Co  in an all-cash deal valued at $6.4 billion  as the world's second-largest chicken processor seeks to expand its protein footprint with Hillshire's sausages and lunch meats. | Video

column4: Bets in Hillshire ahead of Pilgrim's bid raise eyebrows
column5: NEW YORK Hillshire Brands Co  saw a spike in bullish options bets in the days prior to a Tuesday takeover offer from Pilgrim's Pride Corp   even as the company was in the midst of a big acquisition of its own that had hurt its share price.

column4: Bets in Hillshire ahead of Pilgrim's bid raise eyebrows
column5: NEW YORK  May 27 Hillshire Brands Co saw a spike in bullish options bets in the days prior to a Tuesday takeover offer from Pilgrim's Pride Corp  even as the company was in the midst of a big acquisition of its own that had hurt its share price.

column4: US STOCKS-Futures up on ECB hopes  merger activity
column5: NEW YORK  May 27 U.S. stock index futures rose on Tuesday  ahead of a data-heavy session  as expectations for rates cuts by the European Central Bank stoked bids for equities even as the benchmark S&P 500 index closed at a record on Friday.

column4: Japan's Renesas to sell display chip business to Synaptics: sources
column5: TOKYO Renesas Electronics Corp plans to sell its majority stake in a maker of iPhone display chips to Synaptics Inc  another smartphone chip supplier  according to sources familiar with the matter.

column4: Japan's Renesas to sell display chip business to Synaptics -sources
column5: TOKYO  May 27 Renesas Electronics Corp  plans to sell its majority stake in a maker of iPhone display chips to Synaptics Inc  another smartphone chip supplier  according to sources familiar with the matter.

column4: Vodafone Qatar Q4 loss narrows as customer base expands
column5: DUBAI  May 27 Vodafone Qatar  an affiliate of Vodafone Group  reported a narrowing fourth-quarter loss on Tuesday as the telecom operator increased its customer base by more than a fifth.

column4: India automakers hope Modi ditches Byzantine tax system for GST
column5: MUMBAI  May 27 Indian carmakers  battered by two years of slowing sales  hope  the resounding election victory by India's new leader will spur  replacement of the country's complex array of duties with a simple goods and services tax (GST).

column4: EU regulators to decide on Vodafone  Ono deal by July 2
column5: BRUSSELS European Union antitrust regulators will decide by July 2 whether to approve British telecoms group Vodafone's 7.2-billion-euro ($9.81 billion) bid for Spanish cable operator Ono  the European Commission said on Monday.

column4: U.S. agents help probe 'bottle bomb' incidents near Washington
column5: ANNAPOLIS Md Federal bomb experts were helping investigate a spate of "bottle bomb" incidents at AMC movie theaters in Virginia and Maryland   a spokesman for the Bureau of Alcohol  Tobacco  Firearms and Explosives said on Tuesday.

column4: REFILE-Greenpeace protesters board Statoil's Arctic drilling rig
column5: OSLO  May 27 Activists from environmental group Greenpeace have climbed aboard an oil drilling rig in the Norwegian Arctic on Tuesday  trying to stop Statoil's  exploration plans in one of the world's northernmost prospects  the group said on Tuesday.

column4: Republican senator spars with veterans groups on care delays
column5: WASHINGTON The top Republican on the Senate Veterans Affairs Committee fired back at some leading veterans groups on Tuesday after they accused him of a "mean spirited" attempt to politicize the scandal over delays in medical care at VA hospitals and clinics.

column4: UPDATE 1-Thai coup unlikely to pose big risks for Japan automakers-auto lobby head
column5: * Japan automakers say almost no disruptions in Thai operations

column4: Omnicom  Twitter sign $230 mln mobile ad deal
column5: Omnicom Group Inc's  media services division signed a deal worth $230 million with Twitter Inc  that will integrate Omnicom's automated ad buying unit Accuen with Twitter's mobile ad exchange MoPub.

column4: Nearly 400 million Twitter users estimated by 2018 - study
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  May 27 Twitter Inc's  messaging service will have close to 400 million global users by 2018  mostly in Asia  Latin American and the Middle East  consulting firm eMarketer estimated on Tuesday  far short of the 1 billion once expected.

column4: Allergan makes case against Valeant takeover ahead of higher bid
column5: Allergan Inc  on Tuesday built its case with investors for rejecting a $47 billion takeover offer from Valeant Pharmaceuticals International    saying the Canadian drugmaker has overstated the possible savings from the deal.

column4: Allergan says Valeant's offer overstated tax and R&D savings
column5: May 27 Allergan Inc said on Tuesday Valeant Pharmaceuticals International's $47 billion offer overstated the possible savings from the deal in terms of both research and development and in tax structure.

column4: ON THE MOVE--Focus Financial partner LVW hires advisers from Wells Fargo
column5: May 27 Focus Financial Partners LLC said its Rochester  New York-based partner firm  LVW Advisors  hired two veteran advisers from Wells Fargo Advisors to launch a wealth management service for affluent families.

column2: Yingli Green Energy Holding Company Limited
column4: China's Yingli considers taking part in Dubai solar energy project
column5: DUBAI  May 27 Chinese solar panel maker Yingli Green Energy Holding Co.  is considering taking part in a United Arab Emirates solar energy project as part of its 2014 expansion plans in the Middle East and Africa  a company executive said on Tuesday.

column4: Former finance chief of DGSE settles accounting fraud charges
column5: WASHINGTON Dallas jewelry company DGSE Companies Inc and its former chief financial officer agreed to settle accounting fraud charges  the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Tuesday.

column4: Intuit to buy Check Inc for $360 million
column5: JERUSALEM  Intuit Inc INTU.O  developer of tax-preparation software TurboTax  said it had entered into a definitive agreement to buy bill-payment service Check Inc for $360 million in cash and other considerations.

column4: RPT-UPDATE 2-Intuit to buy Check Inc for $360 mln
column5: (Updates with Intuit confirmation; adds comments/background)

column4: Intuit to buy bill-payment service Check Inc for $360 mln - WSJ
column5: May 27 Intuit Inc  developer of tax-preparation software TurboTax  agreed to buy Check Inc  a bill-payment service  for $360 million in a deal that was signed on Friday  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the situation.
